sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含有"律师"之意。
means: attorney ：主要用于美国，指代理当事人处理遗嘱检验等法律事务的律师，有时可与lawyer通用，泛指辩护律师。
lawyer ：普通用词，指精通法律规则并有权以法律代理人或顾问身份在法庭上执行法律或为委托人服务的人。
counsel ：指单独或集体为当事人提供咨询或出庭处理案件的法律顾问或律师。
advocate ：专指以罗马法律的基本法制的一些国家的(如苏格兰等)和一些特别法庭的律师；也可指出庭辩护的律师。

Although more than half of Harvard undergraduates end up in law, medicine or business, future doctors and lawyers must study a non- specialist liberal-arts degree before embarking on a professional qualification.

There is pressure for change from within the profession, but opponents of change among the regulators insist that keeping outsiders out of a law firm isolates lawyers from the pressure to make money rather than serve clients ethically.

There is just one path for a lawyer in most American states: a four-year undergraduate degree in some unrelated subject, then a three-year law degree at one of 200 law schools authorized by the American Bar Association and an expensive preparation for the bar exam.

sentences.en: Vera is studying law because she wants to become a lawyer.
sentences.cn: 维拉正在学习法律, 因为她想当律师。</seg>

entry.def: A lawyer is a person who is qualified to advise people about the law and represent them in court.

example.ex: Prosecution and defense lawyers are expected to deliver closing arguments next week.
example.tran: 下周控辩双方律师将进行结案陈词。

means.word_mean: 1. a professional person authorized to practice law; conducts lawsuits or gives legal advice

sentences.cn: 下周控辩双方律师将进行结案陈词。
sentences.en: Prosecution and defense lawyers are expected to deliver closing arguments next week.

sentences.cn: 勇气和胆量就是你必须去做即使你认为做不到的事使之成为可能.
sentences.en: Courage is doing what you have to do even though you are afraid.

sentences.cn: 那个聪明的律师使证人说错了话.
sentences.en: The clever lawyer tripped the witness.

sentences.cn: 他的律师为起草契约所收的费用确实足够了.
sentences.en: The fee his lawyer charged for drawing up the deed was enough in all conscience.

sentences.cn: 你的律师把契约写好了没有?
sentences.en: Has your lawyer drawn up the contract yet?

sentences.cn: 律师机智地为委托人辩护.
sentences.en: The lawyer produced a clever defence of his client.

sentences.cn: 律师声称被告无罪.
sentences.en: The lawyer claims that the accused was not guilty.

sentences.cn: 律师可能拒绝承办他认为站不住脚的案件.
sentences.en: The Lawyer may refuse to undertake a case which appears to him unsound.

sentences.cn: 那律师装上笔尖; 摊开纸张, 准备缮写.
sentences.en: The lawyer nib his pen, spread out his paper, and prepared to write.

sentences.cn: 他们的律师隐瞒证据是不道德的.
sentences.en: It was unscrupulous of their lawyer to withhold evidence.

sentences.cn: 律师需要有周密的头脑.
sentences.en: A lawyer needs a precise mind.

sentences.cn: 她与她的律师商量过了.
sentences.en: She took counsel with her lawyer.

sentences.cn: 被告有一律师为他辩护.
sentences.en: The accused man had a lawyer to defend him.

sentences.cn: 那律师在她年轻的时候就在业内赫赫有名了.
sentences.en: The lawyer reached a position of prominence in her profession at an early age.

sentences.cn: 一个聪明的律师能施小计诱使囚犯承认有罪.
sentences.en: A clever lawyer can cozen the prisoner into an admission of guilt.

sentences.cn: 律师以无可辩驳的论据打赢了那场官司.
sentences.en: The lawyer won his case with an impregnable argument.

sentences.cn: 我有信心你会成为一名成功的律师.
sentences.en: I am confident you would succeed as a lawyer.

sentences.cn: 律师与当事人之间的谈话属于保密信息.
sentences.en: Discussions between a lawyer and client are privileged communications.

sentences.cn: 愤怒的律师用拳头猛击桌子.
sentences.en: The angry lawyer smashed his fists against the desk.

sentences.cn: 她指责她的律师对待委托人的命令式态度.
sentences.en: She rebuked her lawyer for his authoritarian attitude to her clients.

sentences.cn: 这个年青律师被发现有犯罪行为时,被取消执业资格.
sentences.en: The lawyer was disbarred from practice when he was round guilty of unlawful acts.

sentences.cn: 由于双方律师花了许多时间讨论法律细节,我们的离婚推迟了一年多才解决.
sentences.en: Our divorce settlement was delayed by a year because our lawyer spent a lot of time arguing about legal niceties.

sentences.cn: 要想当律师就得花钱.
sentences.en: It takes money to set up as a lawyer.

sentences.cn: 律师在这一问题上继续与他交涉.
sentences.en: The lawyer proceeded to tackle him on this subject.

sentences.cn: 拥有许多著名委托人的律师
sentences.en: a lawyer with many famous clients

sentences.cn: 各公司往往偏爱那些在伦敦金融城的大律师事务所受过培训的律师。
sentences.en: Companies tend to favour the lawyer who has trained with a good quality City firm.

sentences.cn: 遇害律师的朋友们很快发现了两起谋杀案之间的相似之处。
sentences.en: Friends of the dead lawyer were quick to draw a parallel between the two murders.

sentences.cn: 我把今天早上律师念的一字不差地记了下来。
sentences.en: I copied it down the way my lawyer read it to me this morning.

sentences.cn: 他本可以当律师挣大钱的。
sentences.en: He could have made a fortune as a lawyer.

sentences.cn: 他出生在香港，后来在那里从事律师工作，直到退休。
sentences.en: He was born in Hong Kong where he subsequently practised as a lawyer until his retirement.

sentences.cn: 下周控辩双方律师将进行结案陈词。
sentences.en: Prosecution and defense lawyers are expected to deliver closing arguments next week.

sentences.cn: 1629年之后的十年间，大约有九十名知识渊博的牧师来到了马萨诸塞州的教会。除此以外，还有诸如约翰·温斯罗普这样的政治领袖。温斯罗普是一位受过良好教育的绅士，在来波士顿之前曾担任过律师和王室官员。
sentences.en: Besides the ninety or so learned ministers who came to Massachusetts churches in the decade after 1629,there were political leaders like John Winthrop, an educated gentleman, lawyer, and official of the Crown before he journeyed to Boston.

sentences.cn: 南梅先生指出，你可以在三年之内成为一名律师，在四年之内成为一名医生。
sentences.en: You can, Mr. Menand points out, become a lawyer in three years and a medical doctor in four.

sentences.cn: 在世界各地，律师招惹的敌意要比其他任何一个行业的从业人员都多——新闻业可能是个例外。
sentences.en: All around the world, lawyers generate more hostility than the members of any other profession—with the possible exception of journalism.

sentences.cn: 改革这种体制对律师和客户双方都有益处。
sentences.en: Reforming the system would help both lawyers and their customers.

sentences.cn: 行业内部有要求变革的压力，但监管机构中反对变革的人坚持认为，将局外人排除在律师事务所之外能够确保律师在为客户服务时不屈从于赚钱的压力，而是恪守职业道德。
sentences.en: There is pressure for change from within the profession, but opponents of change among the regulators insist that keeping outsiders out of a law firm isolates lawyers from the pressure to make money rather than serve clients ethically.

sentences.cn: 这些足够多的潜在影响是可以观察到的，甚至是显而易见的，因此法官能够也应该给警方、律师和被告提供最新的法律指导。
sentences.en: Enough of the implications are discernible, even obvious, so that the justices can and should provide updated guidelines to police, lawyers and defendants.

sentences.cn: 生物技术工业组织的律师汉斯•萨奥尔解释道，许多公司都渴望获得“连接相关基因点”的专利。
sentences.en: Companies are eager to win patents for ‘connecting the dots', explains Hans Sauer, a lawyer for the BIO.

sentences.cn: BIO最近召幵大会，开展一系列会议针对目前变换的专利情形对律师进行培训。
sentences.en: The BIO recently held a convention which included sessions to coach lawyers on the shifting landscape for patents.

sentences.en: The young murderer remained on death row for ten years while his lawyer appealed to the governor.

sentences.cn: 律师辩称，因某人在未成年时犯的罪而处死他，这是错误的。
sentences.en: The lawyer argued that it is wrong to execute a person for a crime he committed while he was a minor.

sentences.en: Cancers like to give away things. They are good lawyers, architects, designers, and painters.

sentences.en: But as lawyers here discover, there are limits to China's embrace of judicial reform.

sentences.en: A lawyer married a woman who had previously divorced ten husbands.

sentences.cn: 律师应当为当事人保密.
sentences.en: A lawyer should preserve the confidences and secrets of client.

sentences.cn: 琼斯先生死后, 他的律师帮助遗孀妥善处理事务.
sentences.en: When Mr Jones died, his lawyer helped the widow put her house in order.

sentences.cn: 约翰确实不适合担任法庭辩护律师的工作.
sentences.en: John is certainly not cut out for the work of trial lawyer.

sentences.cn: 他从这律师让步的几点上向被告攻击.
sentences.en: He reached the accused through all the concessions made by his lawyer.

sentences.cn: 他的律师为起草契约所收的费用确实足够了.
sentences.en: The fee his lawyer charged for drawing up the deed was enough in all conscience.

sentences.cn: 现在,律师的作用在提高.
sentences.en: Lawyers are starting to play increasingly important roles in society and the economy.

sentences.cn: 当地律师们称,这种例子比比皆是.
sentences.en: Numerous other deals of this sortin the works, say local lawyers.

sentences.cn: 两人后来都成为了法学家,莱赫专攻劳动法.
sentences.en: Both became academic lawyers , Lech specialising in labour law.

sentences.cn: 法学家们估计该地区将成为抗议活动和法律纠纷的焦点.
sentences.en: Lawyers expect the region to become the focus of both direct protest and court challenges.

sentences.cn: 他是一位很有才干的法学家.
sentences.en: He was a very competent lawyer.
